definition: woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
to burn down/to destroy with fire
to burn down/to destroy with fire/trad. also written 焚毀
to burn both jade and common stone/to destroy indiscriminately (idiom)
to play with fire and get burnt (idiom); fig. to play with evil and suffer the consequences/to get one's fingers burnt
to burn the Confucian classics and bury alive the Confucian scholars (acts supposedly committed by the first emperor 秦始皇[Qin2 Shi3 huang2])
lit. to burn zithers and cook cranes/fig. to waste valuable resources/to destroy wantonly beautiful things
to burn the midnight oil (idiom); to work continuously night and day
add firewood to put out the flames (idiom); fig. ill-advised action that only makes the problem worse/to add fuel to the fire

sentences.english: The Story started from Aunt Sam who burned the joss papers(money for the dead)in alane of Tung Pin Chau.
sentences.chinese: 故事由西坪洲冷巷裏焚冥紙的三婆啓初。

sentences.english: When the Norwich Record Office burnt down, it was a potential tragedy.
sentences.chinese: 挪威檔案局的焚倒可能是個悲劇。

sentences.english: That immolates a skin to protect acid-rich skins.
sentences.chinese: 焚一層皮，給含滿酸汁的肉皮蒙一層防曬膜。

sentences.english: Thousands of Copts were demonstrating over the burning of a church in the south of Egypt. Shaimaa Khalil reports from Cairo.
sentences.chinese: 因埃及南部一所教堂被焚，數千科普特人遊行示威。

sentences.english: Burn After Reading will hit theaters on September 12th 2008.
sentences.chinese: 《閱後即焚》將會在08年9月12日上映。

sentences.english: They still think, but she has burned out her ability to care.
sentences.chinese: 他們的眼光依舊，而她已將她介懷的能力焚爲灰燼。

definition: to peel with a knife/old variant of 戮[lu4]
ardent/intense/fierce/stern/upright/to give one's life for a noble cause/exploits/achievements
the Yellow Springs/the underworld of Chinese mythology/the equivalent of Hades or Hell
mound/burial mound/senior (i.e. eldest child or senior in rank)
to extinguish or put out/to go out (of a fire etc)/to exterminate or wipe out/to drown
